description: Erection of detached outbuilding to the rear of the property
decision_conditions: Permitted development rights for erection of extensions or buildings within the curtilage of the main dwellinghouse, were withdrawn by condition 4 of planning permission 13/14797/FUL. Having regard to Article 3(4) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended), the proposed development would not therefore, be lawful.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Please provide a copy of proposed block plan drawn at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.The submitted block plan does not show the proposed development in hatched or shaded.
